tension with proteinuria and convulsions
 ∙ Measure the woman’s blood pressure during every antenatal and postnatal visit. If it is high (more than 
140/90 mmHg), check it again after four hours. If the situation is urgent, the blood pressure should be 
measured after one hour.
 ∙ If the woman has hypertension, check her urine for the presence of proteins. The combination of a raised 
blood pressure and proteinuria is sufficient to categorise the woman as having pre-eclampsia.
